label: Description
value: A flower vase stands on top of a low arch, under which two figures are seated. Most of the background is formed by a tapestry or a curtain. A part of the pedestal and the bottom of a column are shown in the right foreground.

label: Description
value: A crowned escutcheon is flanked by birds and flags. On either side is a seated allegorical women. The left holds a fasces, the right an orb.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash on off-white laid paper

label: Provenance
value: Giovanni Piancastelli, Rome; 1901: acquired by the Museum

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of various donors

label: Description
value: In the center is a candelabrum with a bearded mask sticking out an enormous tong, below, with a cup in the center. From it emerge two animals’ heads, with ribbon-like reins which are held by a fantastic bat flying on top. Laterally are half-figures of a satyress at left, giving a stem to a satyr at right to eat. He satyr has an animal’s head, is facing her, and is supporting a bowl. The half figures rise from scrolls with a fantastic male sphinx below at left, head at right. At left a mermaid, at right a satyress and plants.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite, pen and ink, brush and gray watercolor on laid paper

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of various donors

label: Description
value: Incomplete view of a town with conical roofs situated in a valley bordered by mountains. In the foreground, a tree and a bridge crossing a brook.

label: Description
value: At the center of a landscape if a cluster of trees whose trunks are filled with hatching lines. At left is a group of figures, one who wears a basket on her head. In the background, a town on a steep incline, rising to the left. Clouds in the sky.

Decorative Frame; verso: Frieze with Pageant

label: Description
value: Frame with grotesque decoration. At top center, child and lion masks flanked by half figures of armless mermaids with acanthus tails. Below, escutcheons, trophies, and birds. Blank central panel. Double framing lines. Verso: A figure seated below a canopy in a wagon drawn by cows.

label: Physical description
value: Charcoal, pen and ink on paper

label: Provenance
value: Giovanni Piancastelli, Rome; 1901: acquired by the Museum

label: Credit line
